docblock.description: Library of array functions for manipulating and extracting data from arrays or 'sets' of data.
docblock.long-description: `Hash` provides an improved interface, more consistent and predictable set of features over `Set`. While it lacks the spotty support for pseudo Xpath, its more fully featured dot notation provides similar features in a more consistent implementation.

docblock.description: Get a single value specified by $path out of $data.
docblock.long-description: Does not support the full dot notation feature set, but is faster for simple read operations.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The path being searched for. Either a dot separated string, or an array of path segments.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The return value when the path does not exist

tag.name: return
tag.description: The value fetched from the array, or null.

docblock.description: Gets the values from an array matching the $path expression.
docblock.long-description:
The path expression is a dot separated expression, that can contain a set of patterns and expressions:
- `{n}` Matches any numeric key, or integer. - `{s}` Matches any string key. - `{*}` Matches any value. - `Foo` Matches any key with the exact same value.
There are a number of attribute operators:
- `=`, `!=` Equality. - `>`, `<`, `>=`, `<=` Value comparison. - `=/.../` Regular expression pattern match.
Given a set of User array data, from a `$User->find('all')` call:
- `1.User.name` Get the name of the user at index 1. - `{n}.User.name` Get the name of every user in the set of users. - `{n}.User[id]` Get the name of every user with an id key. - `{n}.User[id>=2]` Get the name of every user with an id key greater than or equal to 2. - `{n}.User[username=/^paul/]` Get User elements with username matching `^paul`.

tag.name: return
tag.description: An array of the extracted values. Returns an empty array if there are no matches.

docblock.description: Split token conditions
Check a key against a token.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The key in the array being searched.

docblock.description: Checks whether or not $data matches the attribute patterns
Insert $values into an array with the given $path. You can use `{n}` and `{s}` elements to insert $data multiple times.
Perform a simple insert/remove operation.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The values to insert when doing inserts.

docblock.description: Remove data matching $path from the $data array.
docblock.long-description: You can use `{n}` and `{s}` to remove multiple elements from $data.

tag.name: param
tag.description: A path expression to use to remove.

docblock.description: Creates an associative array using `$keyPath` as the path to build its keys, and optionally `$valuePath` as path to get the values. If `$valuePath` is not specified, all values will be initialized to null (useful for Hash::merge). You can optionally group the values by what is obtained when following the path specified in `$groupPath`.

tag.name: param
tag.description: Array from where to extract keys and values

tag.name: throws
tag.description: CakeException When keys and values count is unequal.

docblock.description: Returns a formatted series of values extracted from `$data`, using `$format` as the format and `$paths` as the values to extract.
docblock.long-description:
Usage:
``` $result = Hash::format($users, array('{n}.User.id', '{n}.User.name'), '%s : %s'); ```
The `$format` string can use any format options that `vsprintf()` and `sprintf()` do.

tag.name: param
tag.description: Source array from which to extract the data

tag.name: param
tag.description: An array containing one or more Hash::extract()-style key paths

tag.name: param
tag.description: Format string into which values will be inserted, see sprintf()

tag.name: return
tag.description: An array of strings extracted from `$path` and formatted with `$format`

docblock.description: Determines if one array contains the exact keys and values of another.
Test whether or not a given path exists in $data.
docblock.long-description:
This method uses the same path syntax as Hash::extract()
Checking for paths that could target more than one element will make sure that at least one matching element exists.

docblock.description: Recursively filters a data set.

tag.name: param
tag.description: Either an array to filter, or value when in callback

tag.name: param
tag.description: A function to filter the data with. Defaults to self::_filter() Which strips out all non-zero empty values.

docblock.description: Callback function for filtering.

Collapses a multi-dimensional array into a single dimension, using a delimited array path for each array element's key, i.e. array(array('Foo' => array('Bar' => 'Far'))) becomes array('0.Foo.Bar' => 'Far').)

tag.name: param
tag.description: String used to separate array key elements in a path, defaults to '.'

docblock.description: Expands a flat array to a nested array.
docblock.long-description: For example, unflattens an array that was collapsed with `Hash::flatten()` into a multi-dimensional array. So, `array('0.Foo.Bar' => 'Far')` becomes `array(array('Foo' => array('Bar' => 'Far')))`.

docblock.description: This function can be thought of as a hybrid between PHP's `array_merge` and `array_merge_recursive`.
docblock.long-description:
The difference between this method and the built-in ones, is that if an array key contains another array, then Hash::merge() will behave in a recursive fashion (unlike `array_merge`). But it will not act recursively for keys that contain scalar values (unlike `array_merge_recursive`).
Note: This function will work with an unlimited amount of arguments and typecasts non-array parameters into arrays.

tag.name: param
tag.description: Array to merge with. The argument and all trailing arguments will be array cast when merged

docblock.description: Checks to see if all the values in the array are numeric

tag.name: return
tag.description: true if values are numeric, false otherwise

docblock.description: Counts the dimensions of an array.
docblock.long-description:
Only considers the dimension of the first element in the array.
If you have an un-even or heterogenous array, consider using Hash::maxDimensions() to get the dimensions of the array.

docblock.description: Counts the dimensions of *all* array elements. Useful for finding the maximum number of dimensions in a mixed array.

tag.name: return
tag.description: The maximum number of dimensions in $data

docblock.description: Map a callback across all elements in a set.
docblock.long-description: Can be provided a path to only modify slices of the set.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The data to map over, and extract data out of.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The path to extract for mapping over.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The function to call on each extracted value.

tag.name: return
tag.description: An array of the modified values.

docblock.description: Reduce a set of extracted values using `$function`.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The function to call on each extracted value.

docblock.description: Apply a callback to a set of extracted values using `$function`.
docblock.long-description:
The function will get the extracted values as the first argument.
### Example
You can easily count the results of an extract using apply(). For example to count the comments on an Article:
`$count = Hash::apply($data, 'Article.Comment.{n}', 'count');`
You could also use a function like `array_sum` to sum the results.
`$total = Hash::apply($data, '{n}.Item.price', 'array_sum');`

tag.name: param
tag.description: The function to call on each extracted value.

tag.name: return
tag.description: The results of the applied method.

docblock.description: Sorts an array by any value, determined by a Set-compatible path
docblock.long-description:
### Sort directions
- `asc` Sort ascending. - `desc` Sort descending.
## Sort types
- `regular` For regular sorting (don't change types) - `numeric` Compare values numerically - `string` Compare values as strings - `natural` Compare items as strings using "natural ordering" in a human friendly way. Will sort foo10 below foo2 as an example. Requires PHP 5.4 or greater or it will fallback to 'regular'

tag.name: param
tag.description: A Set-compatible path to the array value

docblock.description: Helper method for sort() Squashes an array to a single hash so it can be sorted.
Computes the difference between two complex arrays.
docblock.long-description: This method differs from the built-in array_diff() in that it will preserve keys and work on multi-dimensional arrays.

tag.name: return
tag.description: Returns the key => value pairs that are not common in $data and $compare The expression for this function is ($data - $compare) + ($compare - ($data - $compare))

docblock.description: Merges the difference between $data and $compare onto $data.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The data to compare and append onto.

docblock.description: Normalizes an array, and converts it to a standard format.

tag.name: param
tag.description: If true, $data will be converted to an associative array.

docblock.description: Takes in a flat array and returns a nested array
docblock.long-description:
### Options:
- `children` The key name to use in the resultset for children. - `idPath` The path to a key that identifies each entry. Should be compatible with Hash::extract(). Defaults to `{n}.$alias.id` - `parentPath` The path to a key that identifies the parent of each entry. Should be compatible with Hash::extract(). Defaults to `{n}.$alias.parent_id` - `root` The id of the desired top-most result.

docblock.description: Replaces variable placeholders inside a $str with any given $data. Each key in the $data array corresponds to a variable placeholder name in $str.
docblock.long-description:
Example: `String::insert(':name is :age years old.', array('name' => 'Bob', '65'));` Returns: Bob is 65 years old.
Available $options are:
- before: The character or string in front of the name of the variable placeholder (Defaults to `:`) - after: The character or string after the name of the variable placeholder (Defaults to null) - escape: The character or string used to escape the before character / string (Defaults to `\`) - format: A regex to use for matching variable placeholders. Default is: `/(?<!\\)\:%s/` (Overwrites before, after, breaks escape / clean) - clean: A boolean or array with instructions for String::cleanInsert

tag.name: param
tag.description: A key => val array where each key stands for a placeholder variable name to be replaced with val

tag.name: param
tag.description: An array of options, see description above

docblock.description: Cleans up a String::insert() formatted string with given $options depending on the 'clean' key in $options. The default method used is text but html is also available. The goal of this function is to replace all whitespace and unneeded markup around placeholders that did not get replaced by String::insert().
Wraps text to a specific width, can optionally wrap at word breaks.
docblock.long-description:
### Options
- `width` The width to wrap to. Defaults to 72. - `wordWrap` Only wrap on words breaks (spaces) Defaults to true. - `indent` String to indent with. Defaults to null. - `indentAt` 0 based index to start indenting at. Defaults to 0.

tag.name: param
tag.description: Array of options to use, or an integer to wrap the text to.

docblock.description: Unicode aware version of wordwrap.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The width to wrap to. Defaults to 72.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The line is broken using the optional break parameter. Defaults to '\n'.

tag.name: param
tag.description: If the cut is set to true, the string is always wrapped at the specified width.

docblock.description: Highlights a given phrase in a text. You can specify any expression in highlighter that may include the \1 expression to include the $phrase found.
docblock.long-description:
### Options:
- `format` The piece of html with that the phrase will be highlighted - `html` If true, will ignore any HTML tags, ensuring that only the correct text is highlighted - `regex` a custom regex rule that is used to match words, default is '|$tag|iu'

tag.name: param
tag.description: The phrase or phrases that will be searched.

tag.name: param
tag.description: An array of html attributes and options.

docblock.description: Strips given text of all links (<a href=.
Truncates text starting from the end.
docblock.long-description:
Cuts a string to the length of $length and replaces the first characters with the ellipsis if the text is longer than length.
### Options:
- `ellipsis` Will be used as Beginning and prepended to the trimmed string - `exact` If false, $text will not be cut mid-word

docblock.description: Truncates text.
docblock.long-description:
Cuts a string to the length of $length and replaces the last characters with the ellipsis if the text is longer than length.
### Options:
- `ellipsis` Will be used as Ending and appended to the trimmed string (`ending` is deprecated) - `exact` If false, $text will not be cut mid-word - `html` If true, HTML tags would be handled correctly

tag.name: param
tag.description: An array of html attributes and options.
